intro: Strobilopsis, commonly known as the "cushion moss," is a genus of small, mat-forming mosses belonging to the family Dicranaceae. These plants typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices, where they form dense, cushion-like colonies. Strobilopsis species are characterized by their short, branching stems and leaf-like structures that are often curved or twisted. The reproductive structures, called strobila, are clustered at the tips of the stems and produce spores. Due to their delicate nature, they play an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in their ecosystems.
